meanings.definition: To clear the throat loudly in a disapproving or irritated manner.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa was harumphing loudly when he saw the messy room.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help harumphing when her colleague made the same mistake again.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a little harumph before walking away from the new dog.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine was harumphing as it struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's constant harumphing finally caught the students' attention.

meanings.definition: The act of expressing disapproval or irritation through a loud clearing of the throat.
meanings.sent1: His constant harumphing during the meeting made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The audience could hear the judge's harumphing from the back of the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The baby's adorable harumphing sounds made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The old man's harumphing was like a warning signal to the noisy kids.
meanings.sent5: The cat's harumphing was a clear sign of its displeasure with the new food.
